meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a moraine.
meanings.sent1: The morainal landscape was dotted with rocks and debris left behind by the glacier.
meanings.sent2: The hikers marveled at the morainal formations created by the retreating ice.
meanings.sent3: The morainal terrain made it challenging for the explorers to navigate through the rocky mounds.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a morainal field of memories, each one a different shape and size.
meanings.sent5: The morainal scenery etched itself into their minds, a testament to the power of nature's sculpting.

meanings.definition: Consisting of or resembling a moraine.
meanings.sent1: The morainal deposits along the riverbank indicated the past presence of a glacier.
meanings.sent2: The morainal soil provided fertile ground for the farmers to grow their crops.
meanings.sent3: The morainal pattern on the fabric reminded her of the rugged beauty of the mountains.
meanings.sent4: His voice had a morainal quality, rough and uneven yet strangely captivating.
meanings.sent5: The morainal rocks stood as silent witnesses to the ancient movements of the earth.
